item.title: How Incomplete Arguments Are a Disservice to Your Cause
item.description: Bernie Sanders recently posted a tweet. It read: When we talk about income and wealth inequality in America today, this is what we’re talking about. Right now, the two wealthiest people own more wealth than the bottom 40%. Got that? TWO PEOPLE own more wealth than 40% of our people. Is that remotely acceptable to you? https://twitter.com/BernieSanders/status/1479586559720673287 ðŸ”—The replies were filled with simple, yes or no answers. This is an example of a common problem with modern argumentation, which can be seen from all over the political spectrum.
